fields.summary: test failure in XML tests, TriggerTests and BooleanValuesTest with ibm 1.6 sr 15 in 10.7 and earlier

creator.name: myrna
creator.emailAddress: m dot v dot lunteren at gmail dot com

reporter.name: myrna
reporter.emailAddress: m dot v dot lunteren at gmail dot com

author.name: myrna
author.emailAddress: m dot v dot lunteren at gmail dot com

comments.body: The reason why this does not occur with 10.8 and up is because of the rewrite in this area of DERBY-2739.

updateAuthor.name: myrna
updateAuthor.emailAddress: m dot v dot lunteren at gmail dot com

author.name: myrna
author.emailAddress: m dot v dot lunteren at gmail dot com

comments.body:
Note, that this also did not fail with 10.7 and lower with IBM 1.6 SR14. The change is due to a fix in the IBM JVM to address Oracle Security Fix 6657673, which I believe is this: http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2013-1518. 

I believe the same behavior would be seen with ibm 1.7 sr6 (vs. sr5), but I don't test versions older than 10.8 with ibm 1.7.

The XMLSuite has many more tests than what shows up in the output, looks like it bails out somewhere after the first few fixtures.

updateAuthor.name: myrna
updateAuthor.emailAddress: m dot v dot lunteren at gmail dot com

author.name: myrna
author.emailAddress: m dot v dot lunteren at gmail dot com

comments.body:
Attaching a patch on the 10.7 branch which adds a number of privileged blocks in the following classes:
M       java\engine\org\apache\derby\impl\sql\compile\BinaryOperatorNode.java
M       java\engine\org\apache\derby\impl\sql\compile\UnaryOperatorNode.java
M       java\engine\org\apache\derby\iapi\types\XML.java
M       java\engine\org\apache\derby\iapi\types\SqlXmlUtil.java

and adds accessClassInPackage permissions in:
M       java\testing\org\apache\derbyTesting\functionTests\util\derby_tests.policy

Patch put here for reference and discussion.

updateAuthor.name: myrna
updateAuthor.emailAddress: m dot v dot lunteren at gmail dot com

author.name: myrna
author.emailAddress: m dot v dot lunteren at gmail dot com

comments.body:
I worked through the code to add privileged blocks and derby_tests.policy permissions so that the XMLSuite suite and lang.TriggerTest passed. Running full suites.All now to make sure I didn't miss any.

But I wonder if this is a lot of changes for an older branch for a problem only happening with one vendor's jvm? I am wondering if it would be ok to just run these tests without securityManager (i.e. wrap them in SecurityManagerSetup.noSecurityManager) instead.

I cannot tell how likely it is for people to run into this apart from the tests, especially as this does not occur with 10.8 and later. I do think it would be quite involved for a user to wrap privileged blocks around any code accessing XML values in the database. So even if we do the noSecurityManager approach, we should leave this open, in case we need to apply the patch after all...

Opinions?

updateAuthor.name: myrna
updateAuthor.emailAddress: m dot v dot lunteren at gmail dot com

author.name: knutanders
author.emailAddress: knut dot hatlen at oracle dot com

comments.body: I don't have any strong opinions on whether this should be fixed in the tests or in the product. I wouldn't spend a lot of time myself fixing it and verifying the fix, though, when users have the option to take a newer version if they run into the problem. I do however think that when the problem is fixed in a way so that the tests run cleanly again, the issue should be closed. Leaving it open in case a user who wants it to be fixed in a different way turns up, doesn't seem to provide much value (that user could file a separate bug or reopen this one), but could mean slightly more work for us in future bug triages.

updateAuthor.name: knutanders
updateAuthor.emailAddress: knut dot hatlen at oracle dot com

author.name: myrna
author.emailAddress: m dot v dot lunteren at gmail dot com

comments.body: The backport to 10.3 happened in revision 1541349. (The automatic commit message went to the wrong issue.)

updateAuthor.name: knutanders
updateAuthor.emailAddress: knut dot hatlen at oracle dot com

author.name: myrna
author.emailAddress: m dot v dot lunteren at gmail dot com

comments.body:
Implemented the change to run the affected tests without security manager in branches 10.7 to 10.3.
With thanks to Knut Anders for fixing up commit messages with muddled JIRA numbers. 

It does indeed not make much sense to keep this open because now the tests pass.

If someone finds this affecting them in production upon upgrading to IBM jvm 1.6 SR15 (and IBM jvm 1.7 SR6, although I think that's untested with older derby releases), then they have the following options:
1. move from whatever old release of Derby they're on to a newer version (newer than 10.7, preferably of course the latest).
2. 
   a. stay on the old jvm
   b. optionally contact IBM to get a different solution in the JVM for the security problem.
3. open a new jira issue and lobby with us to get us to add all the privileged blocks of my first patch, *and* modify their application's policy file to add the same privileges I added into derby_tests.policy in that patch.

Option 1 strikes me as the most efficient.

updateAuthor.name: myrna
updateAuthor.emailAddress: m dot v dot lunteren at gmail dot com

author.name: myrna
author.emailAddress: m dot v dot lunteren at gmail dot com
